perturbation.original_text: 12.4 Sole Remedy. Each party agrees that the sole and exclusive remedy for a breach of the warranties set forth in this Section 12 shall be the indemnification set forth in Section 13 below.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.4 Sole Remedy. Each party agrees that the primary remedy for a breach of the warranties set forth in this Section 12 shall be the indemnification set forth in Section 13 below. However, the non-breaching party retains the right to pursue equitable relief, including specific performance, at its discretion.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states indemnification is the 'sole and exclusive remedy', while the modified text allows for 'equitable relief' in addition to indemnification. This creates a contradiction as to whether indemnification is the only recourse, introducing uncertainty in enforcement.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 During the Term, (a) Women.com will not buy, sell, display, distribute advertising from (including, but not limited to, banner ads, buttons, badges, text links, hyperlinks or editorial mentions) or otherwise promote a Competitive Company on any page of the Diet Center
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 During the Term, (a) Women.com will use commercially reasonable efforts not to buy, sell, display, distribute advertising from (including, but not limited to, banner ads, buttons, badges, text links, hyperlinks or editorial mentions) or otherwise promote a Competitive Company on any page of the Diet Center. However, inadvertent placement of such advertising shall not be considered a breach of this section if promptly rectified upon notification by eDiets.
perturbation.explanation: The original text imposes a strict prohibition ('will not'), while the modified text introduces a 'commercially reasonable efforts' standard, and allows for 'inadvertent placement'. This creates a contradiction as to the level of obligation Women.com has regarding competitive advertising, making enforcement of the exclusivity provision less certain.

perturbation.original_text: 8.4 Privacy. eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). In no event shall eDiets disclose or otherwise transfer to any person or entity any Women.com Data that individually or in the aggregate identifies the identity, habits or transactions of the Women.com users.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.4 Privacy. eDiets agrees to treat all consumer data collected from Women.com users on the Women.com Site in accordance with Women.com's then-current privacy and security policies (the "Women.com Data"). eDiets may use anonymized and aggregated Women.com Data for internal research and marketing purposes, provided that such use does not violate applicable privacy laws. Further, eDiets may disclose individual Women.com Data with explicit consent from each individual user.
perturbation.explanation: The original text strictly prohibits any disclosure of Women.com Data that identifies users. The changed text allows for the use of anonymized data for internal purposes and disclosure with user consent. This contradicts the absolute prohibition in the original text, introducing uncertainty about the permissible use of the data.
